website_summaries.verdict: The second generation of the energy-saving Nest Learning Thermostat puts this device even further ahead of the (nearly nonexistent) competition.
pros: Easy to install and easy on the eyes, the Nest Learning Thermostat learns your heating and cooling preferences over time, so you don't have to program it
Wi-Fi networking and tasteful apps let you control and monitor your Nest from afar
cons: At $250, the Nest is so very expensive, and large homes may need more than one

customer_reviews.title: Short Life, too many codes and issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is a brick waiting to happen. I installed this a few years ago....dead in the water now. If you have a Nest Thermostat, don’t get attached to it. It worked fine until there were issues. And with so many different codes for this thing to not work is extremely overwhelming. I will never buy another one, as I write this sitting in a hot house waiting for an AC man to replace this junk. Is it worth the money, not a chance. It is way to sensitive for what it is supposedly designed to do. This a throw away product. What ever money I saved by using this product found it’s way into the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L

customer_reviews.title: a fine temp control unit/box
customer_reviews.text: bought a new house a few years back and opted to install my own AC unit and got the Nest unit at the same time. i cant recall how i used the instructions - (in box or online) - to get it connected in place of the installed one that came with the house. suffice to say it was very easy. had this installed, on my network, wires connected, etc within about 20 mins, maybe less. worked like a charm for the years i was in my house. never had an issue with it at all. will be looking to get another for my next house.
customer_reviews.author: nevermore

customer_reviews.title: Whose idea was this?
customer_reviews.text: What is this doing for me? I can't figure that out. Mostly I ignore it, and occasionally it drops off the network and demands attention. Somewhat more often my kids change the temperature, and then it changes the schedule. Now I'm visiting the website to fix that, and it's giving me nothing but a spinning icon on an otherwise empty page. Incredible. Useless!
customer_reviews.author: William Hoke

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than you think
customer_reviews.text: Features work as advertised , but after a year or more it said it had lost power on the Rc terminal. I had to call a service person to repair it. They found the red wire was not making connection at the Nest base. The spring clip connector wasn't decided not to do it's job. The $150 service charge made the Nest a bit more expensive than I had planned. My recent Nest-E decided it needed more power after 8 months of normal use. I had to pay technical to add a common wire to bring more power to it. Nest gives no explanation why all the sudden it does this. Common Nest problem.
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again. After working for 3 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. After working for 3 years without issue, started giving an error that no power being sent to Rh wire. After calling an electrician and confirming that voltage was going through the wire and there was no problem with the HVAC unit, I bought a new 3rd gen Nest. After 4 weeks of flawless operation, it started to not work again. Called Nest tech support and they had me walk through a number of steps but was unable to solve it. I'll probably go back to an analog thermostat
customer_reviews.author: J. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Originally wrote Does not work! It does!
customer_reviews.text: Original review: I installed this device and it would not turn on my outside unit. I called Nest and they determined it to be a bad base. They did not have to as the warranty period was over but they sent me a new base. After installing it with the new base, my outside unit came on but only the heat worked even though the Nest was set to A/C. Don't buy used! NEW: I would like to apologize to iHeaven. I later found that the "professional" installers of my air handler had shorted W1 and W2 inside the handler. Corrected the problem and re-installed Nest. Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Just a terrible product. Setup and installation were very easy but the thermostat doesn't work well. Never keeps the temperature where you want it so you end up trying to program the thermostat based on where it wants the temperature instead of the other way around. The large temperature displayed on the screen in the pictures is NOT the current temperature. It's the set point. The current temperature is not displayed in numbers at all but only in hash marks at the very outer edge of the display. Incredibly difficult to read. Returned this garbage and got a Honeywell WiFi thermostat that works 10000x better and keeps the temperature exactly where I set it throughout the entire day's programming.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Good thermostat but
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea it learns the temperature modes I set during the day. I also like a lot you can adjust it from your cellphone. But in about a year and a half it stopped connecting to any Wi-Fi around so cellphone app became useless. Customer service didn’t help. They said probably Wi-Fi chip is malfunctioning. It still works but you need to adjust it manually. Doesn’t worth the money now.
customer_reviews.author: Rustam Alikhodjaev

customer_reviews.title: Not so smart after all
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this device for almost 4 years. The thermostat is supposed to learn my preferences but night after night I have to adjust the temperature. I don't adjust to a different setting, same setting and yet, no learning. I have never had to interact with any device as often as I do the Nest Thermostat to be comfortable in my own home. I will likely never purchase another Nest product. This technology is more trouble than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Better Luck Next Time Nest
customer_reviews.text: Many complaints about the current version of firmware and it losing connection visibility. I did not have issues for a few days but I am now. I have all of the automatic settings disabled and it still seems to have a mind of its own. It will not turn on when the sensed temperature is outside the desired settings. I hate to contact manufacturers with problems but I may contact them on this. My old Honeywell connected thermostat at least kept the temperature within range. I only bought this product due to it being owned by Google. It does not make Google look good in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Rothrock

customer_reviews.title: Good technology
customer_reviews.text: I like that I am able control the thermostat with my phone and with the echo. I have already saved on my electric bill since I'm able to adjust when I am away from home. Although the nest automatically detects no one is home and it does set to temp you specify. The only thing is that at night it seems to put the temperature extremely low and I wake up shivering. No matter how many times I keep readjusting it just seems to keep changing the temperature at that number, which by the way, we never set in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mayi

customer_reviews.title: ... about a month or so and we are very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about a month or so and we are very happy with it. We love being able to control the thermostat with our cell phones, and we now have Alexa and can just tell her to adjust heat or cool as necessary. It has a lean mode so most of the time we don't even need to touch the dial or make changes as it does it. Another nice feature is that the dial light goes on automatically when you approach it.
customer_reviews.author: TravelGuy

customer_reviews.title: When it stops working put your old thermostat back on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from my father for Christmas. It worked for about one week and then he woke up to freezing cold house. He didn't realize that his problem was the Nest thermostat so he called in a furnace expert. I'm glad he saved his old thermostat because that was the only problem. Besides the fact that he had to pay a $300 bill. I feel terrible that I bought him such a bad gift.
customer_reviews.author: Frida

customer_reviews.title: May cause costly problems in certain setups.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful, not as friendly as they publicize. Certain types of installation simply will not work properly with this device. Search the forums for the issues when no "C" or Common cable to supply the energy to the Nest is available. Also the mechanism to start the evaporator fan sometimes fail in certain types of connection, making the condenser work with no evaporator fan freezes the whole system, eventually damaging the compressor. In my case this costed me $1000 to have it repaired. In most cases Nest will do fine, but I hate that they misrepresent the issued with the device when there is plenty of evidence and discussions in the forums about its flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Luis G. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, easy setup . unfortunately, it does not work on 2 wire thermostat systems with radiant heat only.( like the old Honeywell pucks ) .I added the third wire and the confirmed it to be correct , I confirmed the wire setup with forums and schematics and this stat needs 3 wires ( 24vac line, Valve control and neutral) I attempted all six different parities and still not luck. and the unit says it found the new wire setup and it is ready. But still the stat just sits there and does nothing. I suppose this recommended for other situations like cooling and heating, but not just heating.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Great product with excellent customer support. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my home because I have two zones of air-conditioning. They actually were pretty easy to install (I’m not great at these things). Use is great. Customer support is excellent. I figure they save me about 30% on my electric bill in this hot climate with a lot of air conditioning.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: My favorite purchase yet.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. By far my most intelligent boredom purchase yet! So far (First month of use (Mid-Summer)), the thermostat has made my electric bill drop by 35 bucks. So if this thing stays at this rate during high energy usage times, then it will more than pay for itself in no time. Set up was extremely easy. I mean... if you can read and have the ability to grip a screw driver, you can set this up. Also, it comes with it's own wall plate, so ordering a stainless steel wall plate isn't necessary, unless you just want the contemporary look.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Rendered worthless by back-end change
customer_reviews.text: Nest announced on May 7th 2019 that on August 31st 2019 all third party integrations will be severed. This renders the device useless to me, and I must purchase something else to suit my needs. I think that this is evidence enough that buying any product from Google is a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: This is a luxury item for sure. It's hard to say anybody "needs" this item. That said, it has great benefits. Installation was extremely easy and Nest has great support for any questions. The Nest unit automatically learned the times that I am home. After a month of using the Nest, my usage and power bills were down. It's great to be away on a trip for the weekend and be able to pre-cool or heat my home when I'm about an hour away from arriving. A lot of the Nest is eye candy. It obviously has an Apple-like feel. But in addition to the eye candy, there are numerous benefits to a Nest. The only downside is the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Lord

customer_reviews.title: Temp is a bit off
customer_reviews.text: The features and functions of this thermostat are amazing and worth the price. I use the iphone app all the time to control temperature and see what's going on in the house. The range of options are impressive. My one complaint is that the temperature it shows is off by 3 degrees on the high side and there is no way to adjust this in the settings or to recalibrate it. Drives me nuts, especially on such a great piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: urwink

customer_reviews.title: It's discardable after the warranty period. No parts, no way to fix.
customer_reviews.text: Works great until something goes wrong. Base plate, which contains the circuitry to turn things on/off malfunctioned. Compressor signal stuck on ON all the time. After an endless saga with support asking all sorts of silly questions and requests of pictures (I am an engineer), the final answer was that the unit was out of warranty and there was no way replace the base plate. You need to buy an entire new unit.
customer_reviews.author: Grubba

customer_reviews.title: Great Installation Support
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about the Nest is the level of service you get from the company in installing it. If you do your own installation, they will talk you through every step and stay with you until you get it installed. Each installation is sufficiently complex as to require a custom adjustment depending on which old unit you are replacing and how your individual furnace works, so there are many variables, and they expect to spend an hour or more on the phone helping you to work out a successful install. I am impressed with the quality of their support. Without it, a unit like this would have to be professionally installed in the majority of cases.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: only if it work
customer_reviews.text: Had a licensed electrician came to do some electrical work and to install this. To be honest, the electrician have nothing good to say about this thermometer. Got everything wired in and Nest kept prompting error E29 (no power to Common wire). This literally pissed the electrician off and he showed it to me that there is indeed power to the Common wire. So, we went with a regular thermometer and everything work in less than five minutes. What a waste as this is such an lovely product that I wish to have install in my home. I am still planning to get this running and will give Nest cs a call later today or tomorrow. Bummer.....
customer_reviews.author: HE

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Very happy, fantastic product. High quality materials, it feels solid. Perfect interface, easy setup. Installation was a breeze, the hardest part was fixing the drywall scarred by the old thermostat, which had a larger footprint. After the Spackle and paint dried, actual installation took maybe 15 minutes, although I am somewhat handy. Got our first email showing the month's energy usage, which I love. I won't go into all of the features, you can read that in the description, I'll just say that features-wise, nothing is overkill or useless in nature, and I don't feel like anything was left out. Looking forward to future integration with more home automation products from Google.
customer_reviews.author: Government Drone

customer_reviews.title: airwave is a very nice feature, and the smartphone interface is simple
customer_reviews.text: My energy bills have gone down, I've been able to reduce energy consumption, and I can manage my system usage remotely. Install and setup was a breeze, airwave is a very nice feature, and the smartphone interface is simple. My only point of improvement would echo what many others have requested in having a geo-fencing feature, where you can define a box that when you are outside of it, the system turns off, and when you re-enter it, it turns back on, to completely automate the away mode functions more effectively. Notwithstanding this, it's an excellent product that pays for itself and reduces your impact on the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Mayson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Not sure it saves me any money though.
customer_reviews.text: Bought at a discount when the new version came out. It is a breeze to install and took me longer to uninstall the old than it did to install the new. I was afraid it wouldn't work since my furnace is realyl old (1960s). but it started up and works great. I can't speak to the cost savings of having it as I haven't tracked my bills or usage, but it sure is nice to not come downstairs in the winter to a cold living room because it turns on just before it knows I get up everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ron K

customer_reviews.title: ... to honestly say that their customer support is the worse I have seen in this industry
customer_reviews.text: Having put 12 units in at 4 homes I have to honestly say that their customer support is the worse I have seen in this industry. When a product has so many variables that are outside the control of the product itself, and they wish to market it into that environment they must make sure they have a support structure to handle the load of issues that arise. Typically the units are in homes where a plumber must work to interface or fix and installation. Do you want to pay $300 for the time the plumber sits around while you try to get a technical straight answer from Nest? I don't and will not ever install or recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shulman

customer_reviews.title: Installation was quite easy with a modern furnace
customer_reviews.text: Fairly basic actually, was expecting more data and reports to be available, more notification options, features to take advantage of motion sensing, etc. I can't say that it has saved us money, have had it installed for a few months. Installation was quite easy with a modern furnace. No issues training the family to use it. Appreciate being able to easily set multiple schedules and temperature-change times. Auto-away has only kicked in once where we left in the afternoon and did not return until late in the evening. Wife and I work at home so are generally always around. Not sure I'll install in new house, but is cool to have.
customer_reviews.author: chouse

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I see that most of the negative reviews are from heater people that live in cold climate. I live here in California I absolutely love it. I figured I would be turning on my air conditioner before my half hour commute from work. But I end up using it more in bed so I don't have to get my lazy azz out of bed and mess with the thermostat. This product is awesome very easy to install buy it you'll love it if you live in California.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device. Like magic. When you leave the house it turns down the heat to your preset value. When you come home it automatically raises the temperature to your "normal" HOME temperature OR you can turn it to the normal setting when you are on the way home from where ever using your smart phone and the house will warm up to your preset temperature. You can set it to the temperature you want and if you choose it will automatically adjust the house temperature so you wake up to the preset temperature. It knows how long it takes to get the house warm again and automatically turns up the temperature so it is "correct" when you wake up.
customer_reviews.author: extech

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and program, the you tube tutorial is perfect as well as the written instructions. It come with everything you need, plates, screws, labels, even a screw driver. This is my second Nest, i can control both from the same app on my phone even though the units are 500 miles apart. Scheduling is so helpful. Oh I also purchased the carbon monoxide / smooke detector, Ill let you know how that works out as soon as I put it up!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: It learns what we like and we now longer have to program it or ...
customer_reviews.text: Controllable from anywhere with iphone or android. (Wife has Iphone, I have android). Also control with computer or Ipad or the old fashioned way by setting it by hand. It learns what we like and we now longer have to program it or go downstairs to change the settings. It was easy to install and is saving lots of energy by dropping the temperature way down when we are away. I like the motion detector that turns the visual on when you walk by it. It is truly a very smart thermostat and I am keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Sneirson

customer_reviews.title: He travels a lot so it's great to be able to monitor his place while on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a house warming gift for my boyfriend. He lives in a condo and it was simple to install. He loves the app on his phone and his ability to control it from wherever he is. I can’t speak to whether it really saved him on energy because he installed it upon moving it (so nothing to compare it to) but I can see how it could, especially if you are making a conscious effort to do so. He travels a lot so it's great to be able to monitor his place while on the road. It looks nice on the wall, too.
customer_reviews.author: K L M

customer_reviews.title: Get a NEST, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product even if your not a geek. I was shocked at how easy it was to install. One nice thing it does is email me every month and let me know how many hours my furnace ran. The other great thing is that you walk up to it and it senses you and turns on. Then you spin the outer dial to adjust the temperature and you walk away (It know you left). I think my old Honeywell had the temperature adjustment 20 menu layers deep (Just joking) Very expensive, but Very cool. We now have 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Shorb

customer_reviews.title: Base Plate Shorted Out
customer_reviews.text: I have had the nest 2nd gen for 2 years. Do like the functionality; easy to program the temp cycles. Remote access by smart phone was also good. Recently the furnace turned on and would not turn off. Nest tech told me it was the base plate switch; failed shorted. Seems like a plausible diagnosis based on some posts here and elsewhere. All nest tech support could offer was a 20% discount on gen 3. Seems like a base plate replacement would be something they should offer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second Nest for dual thermostat home
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Nest that I now have in my home. We have a separate heating and cooling thermostats so now that we have 2 Nests they talk to each other and will help to understand the temperature in the house and adjust accordingly. Easy to attach to the wall. Before I purchased this Nest I checked my wires to make sure it would work. Once that was confirmed it was easy to setup and add to my Nest account. I would say easy because I have done this a few times but to a new user it would be medium difficulty. Defiantly doable if you are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Family Size

customer_reviews.title: beautiful but fickle
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful to look at. Works well for the most part. But has a serious problem with battery recharging. Due to constant low battery level, the units (I have 3) go offline with dismaying frequency. I was away for one week, setting the units to AWAY to save on heating. But I found the units revert back to standard setting when offline, setting off heating. I tried to reset the units to HOME one hour before arrival, but couldn't because they were offline. Very annoying. Since then I read others citing similar problems with battery. The idea of the unit is great. But NEST needs to correct this problem.
customer_reviews.author: public name

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT THERMOSTAT: Quality look - Simple setup - Remote access
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is THE thermostat that everyone should consider when buying or replacing your thermostat. Pros: - High quality product in term of looks and functionality - There are no simpler way to hook up wires - System initial setup is dead simple comparing to others. - Remote access from mobile app (Android or I-phone) is a reason I purchased this thermostat. - It's really a smart and learning thermostat thus far. However, the manual/override scheduling is a selling point for me, although I haven't had to use it yet. Cons: None so far.
customer_reviews.author: RTV

customer_reviews.title: does look cool
customer_reviews.text: Best feature is that you can login at work and see where your temperatures are at. I don't think it's saved me any money yet (still says it's learning my usage...it's been two months) it's a nice change to a traditional looking thermostat. Deducted one star...I don't like that google will now be collecting data on me...sure it sounds innocuous, but if you know google, they can glean a lot by correlating data from all of your various points of contact with them (your email, your gps on your android phone, your house data, when you are away, the size of your house...etc...).
customer_reviews.author: Elysium

customer_reviews.title: Love our nest
customer_reviews.text: Love our nest. So easy to control and we feel like we have better control over living environment. Can't beat the price on the last generation model and with the rebate from the utility company, it's a no-brainer. I haven't seen the new generation, but the additional perks didn't seem all that impressive seeing as how they were mostly cosmetic (bigger screen, etc). All the software is the same. We love ours and have no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Will change your life
customer_reviews.text: Just Fantastic. Works great with my furnace/A.C. Was easy to install and join to WiFi. Easy to program.....especially to get detailed when doing from a web browser. Great to check the status of your house....or keep heating/cooling costs down. And great for when you are going to have company come over you can remotely start it from a browser or cell phone. Or if I am in the basement deep into a NetFlix binge and I DON'T WANT TO WALK ALL THE WAY UPSTAIRS. Grab cell phone and make changes....and less then a minute later my furnace is going. Its a lazy man's dream come true.
customer_reviews.author: reptile007

customer_reviews.title: Previous Gen unit but works okay
customer_reviews.text: Changing a thermostat is not common. We upgraded to a Nest but found out this was the previous generation. It works and was easy to install. The phone app works fine and reminds me of filter changes too, but I’m not upgrading anything newer. Set it, learn it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: T Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but Save Money in Long Run
customer_reviews.text: Smart product. Although it is pricy I think I would get my money back in energy saving in a year. Although we had programmable thermostats in our house before a lot of energy wasted when someone forgot to reset the thermostats after overriding them especially when they staying up or leaving the house late. The Nest continuously learning the use pattern and adjust the programming accordingly. The remote monitoring and control features are great also. I have monitor my PG&E bills for the last several months. I think the Nest thermostats I installed saved me an average of $40/month in heating cost. Can't wait to see how they impact my electricity bill when the AC kicks in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: rayan

customer_reviews.title: Hooked it up and there was a 5 degree temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up and there was a 5 degree temperature difference between this one and my old one, got tired of messing with it and unhooked it, Waited a year and thought I would try again and same thing, noticed the base was getting extremely hot, Did a google search and this is a well known problem, I guess if you contact Nest they will replace it. From what I read there is a short in it or a faulty relay. It would not kick my furnace on either. I will update this if I ever get the time to be on hold forever and see what they say. I think it has been remedied since.
customer_reviews.author: MRNurse

customer_reviews.title: Cost way too much to be inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: for $300 I would hope the temp would be accurate. The plus minus 3 degrees is ridiculous for the price. Would of returned it but it fell outside of the return policy. I actually got replacement one form Nest and it still was way off. Ran new wire from the furnace its okish now I guess . Still don't know if I can trust it
customer_reviews.author: Tom p

customer_reviews.title: my phone would be very easily tracked by Google to show that it
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn't Google use their own location services to automatically determine when the occupants of a house are away? It relies only on sensors in the unit itself. Sometimes, when I'm napping upstairs in the middle of the day, it will go into leaf mode and the temperature will climb. Again, my phone would be very easily tracked by Google to show that it, and therefore I, am at home. That being said, it has saved quite a bit of money thus far. It's not paid for itself, but it will get there. Additionally, it's very aesthetically pleasing on my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Way to ruin Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Nests for my family but unfortunately I'm having to return them because of software errors. It appears these errors have been known since early December but a fix isn't coming anytime soon. From their site: "Our support team is busy right now and unfortunately there's a long wait time. So before you call, we'd recommend searching our support site for an answer to your question. We're very sorry about this." Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: dalrympm

customer_reviews.title: The Nest, the Best.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best upgrades I've made to my home. I can't tell you how many ways I've enjoyed being able to control my heating and air from my phone. I've come home from vacation during the heat of the summer and had a three hour head start on cooling my house down. I've been able to crank up my heat in the winter without getting out of bed. I've even enjoyed cranking the ac on my wife while I was at work and it was 20° outside. Not to mention the thing is just sexy. Also, the functionality is very easy to use considering there really aren't any buttons on it. All around, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: John R. Cope

customer_reviews.title: I love the nest
customer_reviews.text: I installed these for everyone in my family. They all love them and it has saved them money by helping monitoring energy consumption. I have seen people complain about the temperature setting automatically changing but that is a setting they have on --- if you turn of the setting then the temp doesn't auto adjust. The nest is super easy to install, just read the directions and you will be set. You can control the temp from you phone or internet. Great life changing product, everyone should install one.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Base broken after two and half years. Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Broken after 2.5 years. Sure it's out of warranty. hmm just over the 2 year warranty period. After diagnosing by my HVAC contractor, it turns out its base broken. The unit drives fan and AC continuously working even when the top piece is detached or with temperature achieved with top on. We enjoyed the convenience of remotely controlling and nice looking, but quite not impressed by a two-hundred dollar gadget lasting for only less than three years... Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Installs easily and has run flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is a really beautiful piece of equipment and has such a nice touch, that you feel like changing settings for no reason at all :-) My only complaint is that the software doesn't feature a quick way to turn on the exhaust fan which used to be a one touch switch on my old thermostat. Fortunately, my fan-exhaust-only schedule that this device manages has greatly eliminated the need for me to activate the fan. Besides a large array of clever functions, I like the hours of operation per month report that I get on my iPhone because it gives me a much better sense for when to replace the filter rather than arbitrarily doing it on a time-based schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Chou

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in less than a year, great product!
customer_reviews.text: These Nest Thermostats are amazing. I have been installing them in my home, vacation home, office, and businesses and they pay for themselves in less than a year in energy savings. I can also control all of them from one easy to operate app on my iphone which is great for my businesses. I can also lock down the thermostat so people cannot set the air conditioner to go too low to where its wasting energy. I recommend this to all my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: JimB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if you have a C wire.  Avoid if you don't.
customer_reviews.text: cheaper than 3rd generation and gets the job done. excellent. Warning. Do not use unless you have a C wire. NEST website will say the unit is compatible without C wire. It is not. I installed it originally without C wire. In middle of the night, NEST went low power and turned on air conditioning while it's 40 degrees outside. I had to wake up the kids, get them all bundled up, went outside to turn off the fuse, and reinstalled my old thermometer with aid of a flashlight. Next day, called in an electrician. He went to the attic, found an unconnected wire. Hooked it up as a C wire for NEST. Now everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Taxol

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but very cool...
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, $300 for a thermostat is a bit much, even for one that has all the features of this product. However, if you bite the bullet and buy one of these, I don't think you will regret it. For me, the best features are that is is controllable over the internet and keeps track of the run time of my furnaces/air conditioners. I can see from a great distance (I live overseas) how often my units run and what my electricity bills are likely to be as a result. I won't be able to live without this technology in the future thanks to my positive experience with this product. Besides, it looks way cool on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: I'm ready for 3rd generation!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I bought the second generation right as it came out and I love it. It has saved me money on my electricity bill and I feel like it can read my mind and change the temp/have the perfect temp for me at any time of the day (I know, it's programmed not telepathic). Great because I can control it with my phone, which I never really have to use because it follows the programming perfectly! I may just be getting the 3rd generation soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Matty G

customer_reviews.title: Temperature Bands are to Big
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about the product, and I like it a lot with one major problem. The air conditioning will only turn on after a shift of three degrees so you go from being really cold to really hot during the night. Most thermostats have a setting where you can control this setting, but Nest does not. I looked at their user forums, and lots of people have been complaining about this with no response from Nest. I really wish I could return it as it was a big investment. Considering just eating the loss so I can have better sleep at night. By the way, even the kids complain about the temperature shifts.
customer_reviews.author: CDN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install (20 min) and simple daily use so far. I have more visibility into my family's energy usage (at least via the thermostat) than I had with the previous thermostat. The Nest picked up our daily temp goals and started working toward that right away. For example, it "learned" that we want the heat to come on a little before 6:30am but then then essentially turn off at night while we're sleeping. None of that required any programming by me. Based on our happy transition to the Nest, I'll be looking into a Nest smoke alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Vitaminj11

customer_reviews.title: Love this thermostats
customer_reviews.text: Love this thermostats. I bought one for myself and have recommended and get 6 of my friends to use it too. Installation is quite easy, as long as you take a picture of the old box showing which wire is which. Plug the wire into the corresponding slot int he new thermostat and it should take only 10-20 mins. Now I get to control the temperature sitting on my couch with my iPhone or turn on the AC in a crazy 105 degree SoCal summer day while I am 30 mins away in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction product to home automation.
customer_reviews.text: Great introduction product to home automation. Awesome build quality EZ setup.. It took more time getting it out of the box. The videos on youtube were very helpful. It took only 5 days to learn our schedule.... NICE! CONS - Techie Alert - You can only manage the device through the NEST website. It would be great if there was local WebGUI for management in the event the website was down. It was down for several hours about two weeks ago (Website was off line from 2400 - 0500.)
customer_reviews.author: QSFYC - Support Guy

customer_reviews.title: We Have Three Nest G2 Thermostats Installed On Three Types Of Systems.
customer_reviews.text: We have three Nest G2 thermostats installed on three types of systems, a modern heat pump/electric auxiliary, a conventional compressor AC/Electric and a low pressure double pipe steam heat system. The thermostats seem to be working as designed. We like the ability to monitor the temperatures and adjust remotely. At this writing there are over 4200 reviews and we can't add much to them other than, at thos time, we like everything about them. If the future requires an edit we will sure do that.
customer_reviews.author: Vridar

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks even better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This item definitely works better and looks better than I expected. It was very easy to install and I'm finding that it's making for greater savings than we expected too. I do wish the consumer was given a little better insight into how the automatic features operate. In this respect, I feel like we're shooting in the dark to a certain extent. Still solidly 5 stars though. From what I've read, it should be expected to pay back in about 2 years, on average. I'm reasonably certain that I will pay back in only one year for us. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Neight

customer_reviews.title: Too large of a temp swing
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Nest for two years now but decided to write this review after becoming fed up with the unusually high temperature swing. It seems as though I am always going from too cold to too hot and there does not seem to be any other solution but to override the temp setting by using the app to cut the heating cycle short. Nest has not addressed this common concern on their forum, so.......I am researching for a replacement now that there are more choices
customer_reviews.author: MacCody

customer_reviews.title: A great home improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific product. My energy bills are significantly less than previously due in particular to the auto away features. I have recently started using the auto fan feature to circulate for 15 minutes an hour between 9am and 7pm while I'm out of he house. In Maryland during he spring and fall there are times when you need heat one day and cooling the next, I prefer not to leave my windows open during he day while I am away and the nest will alternate between heat and cooling without any additional action by me. I gave one to my friends as a wedding present that would benefit them equally.
customer_reviews.author: gregory j.

customer_reviews.title: A modern thermostat
customer_reviews.text: No regrets about buying this thermostat. I installed it myself, and I'm not especially handy. I love being able to set the temp from my phone whether I'm out and forgot to turn up the AC or I'm on the couch and just being lazy. This is my favorite feature. The auto-away function works pretty good, but not perfectly. However, the temp is so easy to change, I don't mind when it thinks I'm away and turns up the temp. My guess is that it'll save me money, but I've yet to look into that too much since I haven't had the unit that long.
customer_reviews.author: Aud222

customer_reviews.title: Overdelivers...
customer_reviews.text: Its rare that you purchase a bit of technology that over delivers these days. I installed the Nest thermostat and had it connected to my wireless network in 20 minutes. Once connected it automatically updated its software. Within a few minutes I was able to set my thermostat. I walked away and came back 20 minutes later to tinker and the display was dark. As I reached up to touch it...it turned on. This device oozes quality and is very solid. Installation is very straightforward, the hardest part was finding solid areas on the wall for the screws... Expensive - but compared to the competition - this is head and shoulder above the crowd.
customer_reviews.author: JoeVolcano

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've owned my nest for a couple of years now. I'm real happy with it. I have no clue if it's helped me save money, because that's nearly impossible to track due to it being so subjective due to changing temps. However I do love the smartphone control and its ability to work with my nest protect, home lights, harmony remote, etc. As far as cosmetics, it looks extremely nice in my wall! Beautifully designed peace.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Love how they all sync up
customer_reviews.text: Pairing these with the nest smoke and carbon monoxide protectors and nest cameras for our home. Love how they all sync up, are accessible from your smart phone, and remember your preferences. These are so easy to program. The only down side is that if you give others access to your account to see your nest cam, they now have access over the temperature of your entire home. This isn't so bad unless you have an older brother who enjoys messing with you.
customer_reviews.author: MBlum

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting better experience.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting better experience ... the iPhone app only has 3 stars in the app store ... It failed to let me enter the thermostat ID so the app was a fail. Perhaps the result of an incompatibility with iOS 8.1.3 on the iPhone 6 Plus ... The online app let me enter the ID and the iPhone app got it in real time and all is working. Now we'll see how the device actually performs. I like the interface ... I had no need to read any how-to so the design is solid. It will be familiar to any iPad user ... as the Nest designer designed the iPad it all makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: William Garber

customer_reviews.title: Security disaster - forces you to make an insecure Wifi passcode.  INSANE!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a glowing review about how this product works, but after going around and around with tech support, I conclude that no one should have this product in their home. The problem is simple and devastating. The device only recognizes short WiFi passwords. Amazingly Tech Support has no idea how many characters is the max, but it's quite short given today's world of hacking. To be clear, if you have a long and complex WiFi password protecting your network, YOU ARE FORCED TO CHANGE IT to something short and relatively insecure to get this product to connect. You literally have to compromise the security of your entire WiFi network and everything attached to it. It's staggering.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Almquist

customer_reviews.title: What was once a "smart" thermostat is now just plain stupid
customer_reviews.text: After two-plus years, I am throwing in the towel on the Nest thermostat. The online connectivity feature and the ability to control remotely via app has become so unreliable and bug-ridden that it is functionally indistinguishable from a "dumb" thermostat. Nest blames it on my router, but in fact what once worked flawlessly now barely works at all and the only thing that has changed is firmware updates. So, you do the math. Google seems to have taken a great product and ruined it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I loved waking up to 60 degree temperatures this winter
customer_reviews.text: Wifi is extremely unreliable due to some glitch that kills wifi to save battery. I loved waking up to 60 degree temperatures this winter. Also, I dont feel like this nest has "learned" anything in the year that we've had it. Auto-away sucks as well because there is no way to tell the nest it is in an area that doesnt get much traffic. So it always thinks we are away. Looks good and wifi is great when it works. Lots of potential, but it isnt there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Patin

customer_reviews.title: I want to be able to talk to it
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I wish it had was the ability to recognize my voice when I yell at.... and yes, I have given it a name and talk to it. It will go into away mode if I'm in the living room for an extended period of time. I can always tell because it starts to get warm or cool depending on the season. I want to be able to yell out "damnit Nesty, I'm still home!" and have it recognize I'm home. Instead I just have to get up and go walk by it or use the app on my Android phone to tell it I'm still home.
customer_reviews.author: None Ya

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Nest makes my life so much easier. This was easy to install. It took about 30 minutes for 2 smart people that have no experience with thermostats :). The Nest is attractive and feels of high quality. I love that the Nest presumably saves me money (I haven't had it long enough to get my first bill) and increases my comfort as I no longer have to wait until I get home to turn up my heat. Also, this makes me aware of my energy usage through tracking daily energy usage and providing an icon if the time the furnace was on was average or whether it was altered by weather or my changes. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: echo_star

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out thermostat
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best thermostat I've ever owned. These thermostats are robust and very quiet. No annoying loud relay clicks like you hear on other models. Installation and setup is a snap, and the autolearn feature, while not perfect, does a good job at learning when you're home and when to use energy and when to save it. Controlling the unit from remote (iphone or iPad) may be it's best feature, as you can put it in "away" mode after you've left the house, and turn them back "on" when you're about to arrive home. I also like the monthly energy savings reports that are emailed to you, showing you how much energy the Nest has saved. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit pricey for a thermostat, but you're getting at lot more than a simple thermostat. The display is large and clear, something that bugged me about my previous thermostat. I enjoy that you can have it learn totally autonomously or control everything manually. Everything is customizable. I especially like the WiFi control from my iPhone, iPad, or Mac. The energy reports are enlightening, especially since I rarely keep track of my "usage" (who does?). The dial/push button are the only moving parts which provides extremely simple navigation of menus. It's real easy to set up too as Nest provides a tailored wiring diagram on their website. I wholeheartedly recommend this item. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DBo

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermostat ever!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product! The only problem I noticed with it is that if you have a constant changing work schedule, the thermostat will continue its normal 90 day cycle it memorized. I wish I could go online and fill out on a calendar the days I work and the times im home that way it would know ahead of time! Installation is super easy and the app/online site are super easy to use as well! People that come over always ask about it because it is cool looking. I think just about all of my friends have bought one and they love it to! Bravo and thankyou to Nest for creating such an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: D Comrey

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little save lots...In the long run!
customer_reviews.text: The "GREAT BRAIN" I call it for thermostat control---I love this... it's hands free control (almost :) ) Easy to install and if your not a handy person go to YOUTUBE for additional assistance. Its cool to see it glow/view temp info as you pass by it in the hallway in total darkness...another great feature. Also, i downloaded the APP to my IPHONE and control the temperature from anywhere I am! The work to put it all together i.e. removing old thermostat, installing NEST and (if you want to) install the APP on your smartphone is minimal and will eventually same you $$$$$$$$.
customer_reviews.author: Pollywalnuts

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great. The reality less so
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great. The reality less so. The unit creates it's own heat and so is off by 2-3 degrees in it's reading of the temperature in the house. Nest knows about this issue and say it's a function of the wi-fi component/electronics that control the settings and that it is not anything to bother with. They say humans can't notice a 2-3 change in temperature. I disagree. The unit should have been better designed to dissipate heat and not cause this issue. I would not buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: JMT

customer_reviews.title: While the thermostat is great, and the app is as well
customer_reviews.text: While the thermostat is great, and the app is as well, the product is advertised as not needing a C wire. Their online compatibility check is accurate, except occasionally your thermostat WILL need a C wire. This was my case. It took just enough power from the unit that it would not maintain warm air. I had a great family friend who is well-known in the HVAC world come out and look at it, and sure enough, it was doing just as I thought. Low rating for the advertisement of not needing a C wire, and if you do, but don't have one wired, you're out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT IN OLD HOUSE WITH NEW FIRNACES
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2dGen Nest despite all the riews that slammed the product and the customer support. One little glitch installing it, one phone call resolved the prblem and it works flawlessly. I have an old (pre-1920) house with new high efficianvy firnaces. 2wire connectionto the Nest. Less than 10 days to "learn" our household. Never goes off line, at least not yet, and the remote control from an iphone or ipad works like a charm. I expected, after the negative reviews, more issues than I have had. Highly recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Olena

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but paying for itself!
customer_reviews.text: These are expensive but there's nothing like them. My power bill has already dropped some from both the "Away" feature and them learning what we want the temp and when. I had programmable before but these things actually learn every time you adjust them and help you to save money. Now I'm even finding other products these can work with, like light bulbs you can buy that randomly activate on and off when the Nest is in Away mode. Makes it look a little more like you might be home. Neat product.
customer_reviews.author: Shan the Man

customer_reviews.title: Looking Good
customer_reviews.text: Ever walk by your thermostat and say 'wow, that's a sexy thermostat'? Me either, until I plunked this thing onto my wall. It looks great. Like you, I read up on the Nest 2nd Gen and understand that many have had their share of issues. So far, after 1 month, we've had no material issues. I've logged into my account one time to find that I could not connect, however - and validated the wireless connection was fine on the Nest itself. Otherwise, everything seems to be working great. I'll confess I get a little 'pleasure-bump' when I see the green leaf appear and mentally high-five myself each time.
customer_reviews.author: HE HATES THESE CANS

customer_reviews.title: New NEST user.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Purchased a refurbished unit from AMAZON. $206. Thumbs up. If you purchase a refurbished unit, reset before setting up. The NEST is replacing a 1994 thermostat. We have a two story house and the upstairs is always a 3-4 degrees warmer in the summer. After the nest, upstairs is the same or one above and the downstairs isn't chilly and upstairs hot. Will have to wait to see how much we save. Easy to setup and program. Programming is alot easier than the old thermostat, more choices, and don't have to stand squinting, plus no more half hour increments. Will update the review after next month's power bill.
customer_reviews.author: David Thompson

customer_reviews.title: If you're considering it buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I love the next thermostat. I have many and this is my first next gen one. I have the originals that work great. The only bummer is the holes for mounting this one are vertical instead of horizontal like the originals so I had an issue mounting it in the same place as one of my originals. Thankfully I was able to use it in a different location. The bigger screen is nice and I love the convenience of the app.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Money saving buy of the year.
customer_reviews.text: Money saving buy of the year. I can keep the house more comfortable for less money with the handy iOS app. I wish that it had a better ability to determine whether people are home based off of their phone's location, but this will likely come later. Also, the unit has the ability to sense humidity, but it hides that data on a technical page. I look forward to updated software, hopefully without having to buy a new unit. In the end, this unit was definitely worth the buy. It is pretty easy to install and I will remove it when I move out of my apartment complex.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not always compatible
customer_reviews.text: The Nest was beautiful and I wish it had worked. Two trips from installers and finally a certified Nest installer found the problem- it was incompatible with my two zone system! It cost me $250 to find out it wouldn't work. Nowhere in the literature did I see a warning that it did not work with all two zone systems. It was easy to install and if there was not that problem it would have been great, but when it called for heat, the system could not respond correctly and we woke up freezing. Just beware- you might have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful And Love The Interactivity
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, in a new house like ours, it's impossible to know if the Nest is saving us money on our energy bills. But it does so much more than adjust the temperature, it gives us monthly reports on the energy use and allows us to adjust the temp and fan settings from anywhere we are. It auto-detects when we leave the house and when I know we're on our way home I can set the temp to be just right by the time we get there. We feel much more aware of our energy use and are prompted to make adjustments regularly. Pay for the professional installation, it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: We Like Mondays

customer_reviews.title: Automatic firmware update ruined everything
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have your attention. 2013-12-09 before ordering please check the Nest dot com community site support for threads related to the 4.0 firmware update and "low battery" or wifi connectivity issues. After a year of flawless operation, the non-replaceable rechargeable battery is too low to connect to the wifi, which means that you cannot control the unit remotely (which is why it was so great). That also means, of course, that you can't get the firmware update when/if it comes out to fix this. This is a major fail for something that needs to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Careaga

customer_reviews.title: Looks sexy, but the $40 thermostat at home Depot will last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Put your money towards your utility bill instead. You will waste a lot of time trying to get this thing to work properly. Then It will break right after warrenty like most sexy looking electronics.
customer_reviews.author: clint

customer_reviews.title: Good Auto Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install - hardest part was figuring the best way to cover the hole left from removing the previous thermostat as they offer you options and once you go through it all, it is easy to understand - not so easy doing it the first time. Not too bad installation effort overall - electrical installation was quite easy and straightforward. iPhone Software version not very sophisticated but it works.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Love our Nest! Saves us lots of energy and money!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase we've ever made for our house. Saves us a ton of money on heat and a/c expenses. Our house was built in 1960 and insulation was updated in the late '80's but we wanted to do more. We love the "Away" setting on our Nest and the app so we can adjust the thermostat even when we're away from home. We use the app to adjust the temp for pets when we're traveling or checking changes or children may have made while we're away. Nest has made our house in the same energy efficiency category as homes 30 years newer. I can't say enough about how happy we are with Nest!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Skinner

customer_reviews.title: This is Great Thermostat. The web site and the phone app ...
customer_reviews.text: This is Great Thermostat. The web site and the phone app work great. It is easy to program. The only thing is that the optional "Away Mode" sensor is on the thermostat. This make it not as useful if the thermostat is somewhere you normally don't go. I hear that you can buy the smoke detectors and tie the sensors of those devices into the "Away" detection for the Thermostat. I still would like to have a low cost sensor that you could buy that would do the same for the parts of the house you don't have a senor.
customer_reviews.author: C Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Greattttt!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my furnace and thus had those same guys install the Nest. It's work exactly as advertised. Can't wait to see the drop in my utility bills, though admittedly with the new furnace I won't know how much to attribute to replacing the 20 year old unit and to the Nest. [edit one year later] Still love this; however, I can't say this has lowered my utility bill. Admittedly we are not vigilent about setting it to "away" mode. The online interface is good, but the thing I like most is it's 1am and I'm hot or cold it's easy using the phone app to adjust the temp.
customer_reviews.author: txtxyeha

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these thermostats. I have 2 thermostats in my house and replaced both with these. Being able to control from your phone is very cool. I also like to use the scheduler and like the "auto away" feature that turns down or up the thermostat when you leave the house for a while, even if you have not scheduled the temperature to go down or up. Really saves money on energy. Watch the videos on the website as they are helpful. There are many different ways to use the thermostat, so definitely experiment after you get it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've been very pleased, and they've don't a good job at learning our habits. Installation was the best I've ever encountered... I wish everything gave you all the tools you need. The built in level made me very happy too. Was up and running in 5 minutes. I love being able to control everything from the app, and while I had connectivity issues at first with the thermostats, the recent updates seem to have fixed that. Great support from the Nest team as well. A must have for home automation.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Emm

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install as well - just make sure to ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw a big improvement in our energy bill after installing. Very easy to install as well - just make sure to read the instructions. I like the display - very functional, but looks very clean as well. It's a bit expensive, but check with your energy companies. I was able to get reimbursed $100 on this item. It has more than paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: We love our Nest
customer_reviews.text: We love our Nest. We didn't know about the Nest until we saw our neighbors' had one. They told us all about it and so we ordered one. We absolutely love everything about the Nest. Love the easy dial, love the large size numbers, easy to read. Every home should have a Nest. We didn't like our old thermostat, talked about getting something new for years. So glad we got rid of the old one, the Nest is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Folks

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre...more of a "cool factor" than actual energy savings.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze, it's a nice and solid device, but I feel it's lacking something for the cost. I have yet to see any reduction in energy consumption, and we've increased the temperature in our house to make sure we are getting the "energy saver" green leaf . I'll give it more time and if necessary, update the review and change the star rating. In the meantime, it's okay. Not great, not terrible.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Well Done
customer_reviews.text: Very good product solidly constructed of quality materials and extremely easy install. Nice thing about this is that any software glitches can be corrected by future software updates, so you are always kept up to date as long as you are connected to your wifi. We have not noticed any problems whatsoever and it even dresses up the wall. You can even get an accessory that monitors smoke/carbon monoxide and will notify you of issues. I'd imagine that it is expandable in the future to meet more home automation needs. Won't own any other thermostat now.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well excet for auto-away
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install.. Excellent instructions and guidance. The web and Apps are well designed. I like the ability to control the thermostat from anywhere. The only down side is the auto-away feature. I had to disable it since it kept going into auto-away when we were at the house. Even though the thermostat is located in a hallway, it does not get enough motion to keep it thinking we're home. Will it save energy, only time will tell, but it is a very cool gadget if you are into this type of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Andy from Florida

product_meta.title: Nest Learning Thermostat, 2nd Generation, Works with Amazon Alexa
product_meta.description:
The 2nd Generation Nest Learning Thermostat has a new, slimmer design, is enclosed by a solid stainless steel ring, and works with 95% of low voltage systems. The Nest Learning Thermostat learns what temperatures you like, turns itself down when you're away and can be controlled from anywhere over Wi-Fi. By programming itself, the Nest thermostat can save up to 20% on your heating and cooling bill. You just have to teach it well.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Nest Learning Thermostat programs itself and automatically saves energy when you’re away. Control it from anywhere using your smartphone, tablet or computer.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately).
Nest saves energy by automatically turning itself down when you're away
2nd generation design - nest is now 20-percent thinner and works in 95-percent of homes with low Voltage systems
Auto-Away: Nest saves energy by automatically turning itself down when you're away
Auto-Away: Nest saves energy by automatically turning itself down when you're away

Auto-schedule: Remembers the temperatures you like and programs itself. Easy install - most homeowners install nest themselves in 30 minutes or less. After that, it's just a matter of changing the temperature
